requirements.description: Each Party must adhere to their obligations concerning End User data as outlined in the Contract and relevant privacy laws.
A privacy policy must be provided by each Party, which is conspicuous and complies with applicable privacy laws.
The privacy policy must include a clear description of the data sets collected or permitted to be collected, and the use cases related to personal data/information.
The privacy policy must explicitly state that personal data will be shared with certain third parties for specific use cases.

type.summary: Disclosure of Data Sharing with Third Parties

requirements.description: If applicable, privacy laws such as CCPA, CPRA, or other US state privacy laws require providing sufficient notice about End Users' rights regarding their personal information and mechanisms for Opt Out elections.
The privacy policy should mention the use of third parties and cookies for attribution and/or serving targeted advertisements.

type.summary: Third Party and Cookie Usage Disclosure
